00004 assembly* load_pdb(char* file_name)
00005 {
00006   char* temp;
00007   WARN=1;SILENT=1;INWC=0;DATE=0;UNCUT=1;UNx=1;UNy=1;UNz=1;
00008   temp = suf; strcpy(temp,".pdb");
00009   temp = sufc; strcpy(temp,"_change.txt"); ACT='0';
00010   DEBUG=-1;LASTRES=-1;LASTOKX=0;LASTOKY=0;LASTOKZ=0;
00011   UNCTOL=0;CRYX=0;CRYY=0;CRYZ=0;LASTX=0;LASTY=0;LASTZ=0;
00012   //int resNum;
00013   int ma;
00014   //molecule* mol;
00015   assembly* asmbl;
00016   IN = myfopen(file_name, "r");
00017  /*scans pdb file for number of lines
00018   allocates memory for line structures
00019   initializes structures that contain line formats*/
00020   init_struct();
00021   rewind(IN);
00022   //Read in lines to ln structure
00023   printf("Reading in %s...\n",file_name);
00024   for(ma=0;ma<INWC;ma++){
00025   if(DEBUG>=1){printf("made it to here main line loop %d ...\n", ma);} 
00026         rwm_line(ma+1);
00027         }
00028   //Determine the number of molecules in the pdb
00029   printf("There are %d molecule(s)\n",howManyMolecules());
00030   asmbl = getAssembly();
00031   printf("PDB Information Successfully Read.\n");
00032   free(ln);
00033   return asmbl;
00034 }
00035 
00036 molecule load_pdb_from_slurp(fileslurp in){
00037  int i,hldr;
00038  char* temp;
00039  init_struct_slurp(in);
00040  for(i = 0; i < in.n; i++){     //Assign data to the rwm line
00041   rwm_line_char(in.L[i],i+1);
00042   if(isAtom((ln+i))){           //And determine the smallest residue
00043    temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c; sscanf(temp,"%d",&hldr);
00044   }
00045  }
00046  INWC = in.n;
00047  return (*getMolecule());
00048 }

00050 fileslurp isolateInputPDB(fileslurp S){
00051  int i,itr;
00052  char* plc;
00053  fileslurp O; O.n = 0; itr = 0;
00054  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++){
00055   if(strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: ATOM")!=NULL ||         //These cover the two types of
00056      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: HETATM")!=NULL ||       //AD3 style input data
00057      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-LIGAND-PDBQT: ATOM")!=NULL || //These cover the two types of
00058      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-LIGAND-PDBQT: HETATM")!=NULL) //AD4 style input data
00059    O.n++;
00060  }
00061  O.L = (char**)calloc(O.n,sizeof(char*));
00062  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++){
00063   if(strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: ATOM")!=NULL ||
00064      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: HETATM")!=NULL ||
00065      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-LIGAND-PDBQT: ATOM")!=NULL ||
00066      strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-LIGAND-PDBQT: HETATM")!=NULL){
00067    if(strstr(S.L[i],"INPUT-PDBQ: ")!=NULL)
00068     plc = S.L[i]+12;    //Based on what starts the line, duplicate the line minus
00069    else                 //The first couple of words
00070     plc = S.L[i]+20;
00071    O.L[itr] = strdup(plc); itr++;
00072   }
00073  }
00074  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++)
00075   free(S.L[i]);
00076  free(S.L);
00077  return O;
00078 }

00080 fileslurp isolateDockedPDB(fileslurp S){
00081  int i,itr;
00082  char* plc;
00083  fileslurp O; O.n = 0; itr = 0;
00084  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++){
00085   if(strstr(S.L[i],"DOCKED: ATOM")!=NULL)
00086    O.n++;
00087  }
00088  O.L = (char**)calloc(O.n,sizeof(char*));
00089  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++){
00090   if(strstr(S.L[i],"DOCKED: ATOM")!=NULL){
00091    plc = S.L[i]+8;
00092    O.L[itr] = strdup(plc); itr++;
00093   }
00094  }
00095  for(i = 0; i < S.n; i++)
00096   free(S.L[i]);
00097  free(S.L);
00098  return O;
00099 }

00102 int howManyMolecules()
00103 {
00104  int i; int counter = 0;
00105 
00106  for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00107   if(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 1)//If it is a TER, LINK, or CONECT card
00108    counter++;
00109  if(counter == 0 || isAtom(ln+(INWC-1)) == 1)
00110   counter ++;
00111  return counter;
00112 }

00114 assembly* getAssembly()
00115 {
00116   int molNum = howManyMolecules();
00117   int i = 0;int j = 0;int k = 0;int l = 0;int atom_num;double x,y,z;
00118   char* temp;char name[6] = ""; char* atmName = name;
00119   assembly* asmbl = (assembly*) malloc (1 * sizeof(assembly));
00120   (*asmbl).nm = molNum;
00121   molecule* mol = (molecule*) malloc (molNum * sizeof(molecule));
00122   (*asmbl).m = (molecule**)calloc(1,sizeof(molecule*));//added by MNT on 20080806
00123   (*asmbl).m[0] = mol; // changed by BLF on 20080622 -- might need revisiting
00124   molecule* curMol; residue* curRes;// residue* res;
00125   atom* curAtm;// atom* atm;
00126   //Get all the information for the first molecule
00127   curMol = (mol+j);
00128   (*curMol).nr = findTotalResidue(i);
00129   (*curMol).r = (residue*) malloc ((*curMol).nr*sizeof(residue));
00130   getResInfo((*curMol).r,i);
00131   curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00132   (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom));
00133   curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00134   for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00135   {
00136     //If it is a TER, LINK, or CONECT card
00137     if(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 1)
00138     {
00139       j++;
00140       curMol = (mol+j);
00141       (*curMol).nr = findTotalResidue(i+1);
00142       (*curMol).r = (residue*) malloc ((*curMol).nr*sizeof(residue));
00143       getResInfo((*curMol).r,i+1);
00144       curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00145       k = 0;l = 0;
00146       (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom));
00147       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00148     }
00149     else if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00150     {
00151       if(l == (*curRes).na)
00152       {
00153        k++;l = 0;
00154        curRes = ((*curMol).r+k);
00155        (*curRes).a = (atom*) malloc ((*curRes).na*sizeof(atom)); 
00156        //curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00157       }
00158       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l);
00159       //Getting the atom #
00160       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[1].c;
00161       sscanf(temp,"%d",&atom_num);
00162       //Getting the atom name
00163       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[3].c;
00164       sscanf(temp,"%s",atmName);
00165       //Getting the X coordinate
00166       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[11].c;
00167       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&x);
00168       //Getting the Y coordinate
00169       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[12].c;
00170       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&y);
00171       //Getting the Z coordinate
00172       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[13].c;
00173       sscanf(temp,"%lf",&z);   
00174 
00175       (*curAtm).n = atom_num;//set the atom #
00176       (*curAtm).N = strdup(atmName);//set the atom name
00177       //set the atom's coordinates
00178       (*curAtm).x.i = x; (*curAtm).x.j = y; (*curAtm).x.k = z;
00179       l++;
00180     }
00181   }
00182  return asmbl;
00183 }
00184 
00185 int findTotalResidue(int start)
00186 {
00187   int count=0;int i = start;int thisRes;//int curRes = 0;
00188   int inList,j;
00189   char* temp;
00190   int* known = (int*)calloc(count,sizeof(int));
00191   while(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 0 && i != INWC)
00192   {
00193     if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00194     {
00195      temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c;
00196      sscanf(temp,"%d",&thisRes);
00197      inList = 0;
00198      //The New Way
00199      for(j = 0; j < count; j++){
00200       if(known[j]==thisRes){inList=1; break;}
00201      }
00202      if(!inList){
00203       count++;
00204       known = (int*)realloc(known,count*sizeof(int));
00205       known[count-1] = thisRes;
00206      }
00207     }
00208    i++;
00209   }
00210   free(known);
00211   return count;
00212 }

00214 int endOfMol(linedef* line)
00215 {
00216   if(((*line).a == 4 && (*line).b == 2)||
00217      ((*line).a == 2 && ((*line).b == 9||(*line).b == 3)))
00218     return 1;
00219   else
00220     return 0;
00221 }
00222 
00223 int isAtom(linedef* line)
00224 {
00225   if(((*line).a == 2 || (*line).a == 3) && (*line).b == 1)
00226     return 1;
00227   else
00228     return 0;
00229 }
00230 void getResInfo(residue* res, int start)
00231 {
00232   int resNum,j;int i = start;
00233   int count = 0;
00234   residue* curRes = (res+0);
00235   char name [10];char* temp;char* resName = name;
00236   while(isAtom(ln+i) == 0 && i < INWC)
00237    i++;
00238   while(endOfMol((ln+i)) == 0 && i != INWC){
00239    if(isAtom(ln+i) == 1){
00240     temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c; sscanf(temp,"%d",&resNum);
00241     //If this is a different residue than the one in the previous line
00242     if(resNum != (*curRes).n){
00243      curRes = NULL;
00244      for(j = 0; j < count; j++){//Cycle through all of the found residues
00245       if((*(res+j)).n == resNum){curRes = (res+j); break;}
00246      }                          //If it is not a known residue, assign it a new slot
00247      if(curRes == NULL && curRes == 0x0){curRes = (res+count); count++;}
00248      temp = (*(ln+i)).f[5].c; sscanf(temp,"%s",resName);
00249     }
00250     //If this residue has not been found yet
00251     if((*curRes).n < 0){
00252      (*curRes).N = strdup(resName);     //Set the residue name
00253      (*curRes).n = resNum;              //Set the actual residue number
00254      (*curRes).na = 0;                  //...and make sure the total # of atoms is 0
00255     }//Otherwise we can assume all of these have already been set
00256     (*curRes).na++;
00257    }//End if an atom
00258     //..and then incriment to the next line
00259     i++;
00260   }//End loop through file
00261  return ;
00262 }

00264 molecule* getMolecule(void){
00265   int molNum = 1;
00266   int i = 0;//int j = 0;int k = 0;
00267   int ntX,j,rI;
00268   double dblY;
00269   char* temp;char name[6] = ""; //char* atmName = name;
00270   molecule* mol = (molecule*)calloc(molNum,sizeof(molecule));
00271   residue* curRes;// residue* res;
00272   atom* curAtm;// atom* atm;
00273   //Get all the information for the first molecule
00274   (*mol).nr = findTotalResidue(i);
00275   (*mol).r = (residue*)calloc((*mol).nr,sizeof(residue));
00276   //Initialize of the residue numbers to -1 so the program knows they're not used yet
00277   for(j = 0; j < (*mol).nr; j++){(*mol).r[j].n = -1;}
00278   getResInfo((*mol).r,i);
00279   int l[(*mol).nr];
00280   for(i = 0; i < (*mol).nr; i++){
00281    (*mol).r[i].a = (atom*)calloc((*mol).r[i].na,sizeof(atom));
00282    l[i] = 0;
00283   }
00284   //Set the current residue, and residue index to 0
00285   rI = 0;
00286   curRes = ((*mol).r+0);
00287   for(i = 0; i < INWC; i++)
00288   {
00289     if(isAtom((ln+i)) == 1)
00290     {
00291       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[8].c; sscanf(temp,"%d",&ntX);
00292       if((*curRes).n != ntX)//If the residue numbers do not match
00293       {//Seach through all of the resiudes until one is found that matches
00294        for(j = 0; j < (*mol).nr; j++){//then assign it to curRes
00295         if(mol[0].r[j].n == ntX){rI = j; break;}
00296        }
00297        curRes = ((*mol).r+rI);
00298       }
00299       curAtm = ((*curRes).a+l[rI]);
00300       //Getting the record name
00301       temp = (*(ln+i)).f[0].c; sscanf(temp,"%s",name);
00302       (*curAtm).D = strdup(name);
00303       //Getting the atom #
00304       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[1].c; sscanf(temp,"%d",&ntX);
00305       (*curAtm).n = ntX;
00306       //Getting the atom name
00307       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[3].c; sscanf(temp,"%s",name);
00308       (*curAtm).N = strdup(name);
00309 printf("Got atom number %d and name %s in get Molecule\n",(*curAtm).n,(*curAtm).N);
00310 printf("in load_pdb_from_slurp: Atom number %d of residue number %d (%s) has the name %s\n",mol[0].r[5].a[21].n,\
00311         mol[0].r[5].n,mol[0].r[5].N,mol[0].r[5].a[21].N);
00312       //Getting the chain identifier
00313       (*curAtm).cID = (*(ln+i)).f[7].c[0];
00314 
00315       //Getting the X coordinate
00316       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[11].c; sscanf(temp,"%lf",&dblY); (*curAtm).x.i = dblY;
00317       //Getting the Y coordinate
00318       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[12].c; sscanf(temp,"%lf",&dblY); (*curAtm).x.j = dblY;
00319       //Getting the Z coordinate
00320       temp  = (*(ln+i)).f[13].c; sscanf(temp,"%lf",&dblY); (*curAtm).x.k = dblY;   
00321 
00322       l[rI]++;
00323     }
00324   }
00325 
00326  return mol;
00327 }
